channel.title: Finding an a upload link
channel.description:
Okay so... im having trouble finding an upload link that i can direct my client to download cache .zip from all uploading links uses a methods to download in for diff ip like (megaupload.com, mediafire.com....) i need a uploading link that gives me the download link and it auto downloads the file without saying wait.. or click here to download.. just the link and it auto downloads..
Can someone give me an website for uploading that downloads directly?

Okay then i think my problem is solved im gonna make the webclient auto downlaods from the uppit link

item.title: Finding an a upload link
item.dc:creator: @CarScape CarScape
item.description:
@CarScape wrote:

[quote=“Junes, post:6, topic:363353”][quote author=b15 link=topic=459608.msg3362771#msg3362771 date=1286532362]
i use mediafire.com its fast, user friendly, and if you signup (Free) you can organize all your files etc
[/quote]

learn to read the thread not the topic title…

yea but tbh since when have clients been over 70mb let alone over 100mb the bandwidth on it is fairly good or just keep looking its not hard lol[/quote]

my cache is 31MB , i kinda uploaded it 100 times… all shity hosts

that is why i asked Here, why in the hell there is no direct download from normal upload sites …XD
im gonna try uppit and give u the link if it works for you then im saved XD

Edit: try to download this if it auto downloads please tell me
http://server220.uppit.com/files/3/b6s5l51r7r2ea8/cache.zip

Read full topic

item.title: Finding an a upload link

item.description:
@CarScape wrote:

i know i kinda tried using on 2 free webhosts already one said it cant upload more than 15Mb file at once and the other uploaded fine but was slow that the auto cache downloader started giving errors…because of the delay…
and now im trying another site called fileden.com and i kinda guess its slow too,
can you prefer me to that site you have seen?
i used 000webhost.com
and http://zymic.com/

Read full topic

item.title: Finding an a upload link
item.dc:creator: @Junes Junes
item.description:
@Junes wrote:

im not to sure about this one but i have seen a few people use it uppit doesnt have a timer on it i believe and if worst comes to worst and that doesnt work go on google and search for free ftp website hosts when you register for one then you get given webspace alot of bandwidth a month for people to use the download on your site i.e. one site i personally came across was half a gig bandwith a month on the free option. you upload the files mainly by a ftp program (file transfer protocol) but some of the sites have a file manager built in

Read full topic
